intro: Hybanthus supinus, commonly known as the prostrate hybanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in a trailing or prostrate habit, often covering the ground with its numerous small leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, fragrant, violet-colored flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens and greenhouses.
